revised_title: Hyperfine Structure and Zeeman Effect in Potassium Resonance Lines
tldr: The authors studied the hyperfine structure, Zeeman effect, and isotope shift in the resonance lines of potassium using atomic beams and spectrograph techniques. They found that the component of longer wavelength is stronger in both the abundant and rare isotopes, and the results confirm the nuclear spin value. The study also provides insights into the Zeeman effect and the hyperfine structure of the resonance lines, contributing to the understanding of atomic physics.
